com.mapquest.android.maps
Class TrackballGestureDetector

java.lang.Object
  com.mapquest.android.maps.TrackballGestureDetector

public class TrackballGestureDetector
extends java.lang.Object

Utility to analyze the trackball events

Constructor Summary
TrackballGestureDetector()
           
 
Method Summary
 void analyze(android.view.MotionEvent ev)
          Analyzes the trackball events for scroll, long press, double tap and tap events
 float getCurrentDownX()
          The x coordinate for current trackball down event
 float getCurrentDownY()
          The y coordinate for current trackball down event, valid for tap and double tap events
 float getFirstDownX()
          The x coordinate of trackball's first tap for double tap event.
 float getFirstDownY()
          The y coordinate of trackball's first tap for double tap event.
 boolean isDoubleTap()
          Checks if the current event is a double tap event
 boolean isScroll()
          Checks if the current event is a scroll event
 boolean isTap()
          Check if the current event is a tap event.
 void registerLongPressCallback(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
          Registers the runnable which will be invoked for long press event
 void registerTapCallback(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
          Registers the runnable which will be invoked for tap event.
 float scrollX()
          Returns scroll position on x axis, valid only for isScroll() == true
 float scrollY()
          Returns scroll position on y axis, valid only for isScroll() == true

registerTapCallback

public void registerTapCallback(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
Registers the runnable which will be invoked for tap event. It is preferable to use this call to isTap()

runnable -

isDoubleTap

public boolean isDoubleTap()
Checks if the current event is a double tap event

isScroll

public boolean isScroll()
Checks if the current event is a scroll event

Returns:
true if current event is a scroll event

isTap

public boolean isTap()
Check if the current event is a tap event. It is unsafe to use this event to detect tap event, instead use registerTapCallback(Runnable).

Returns:
true if current event is a tap
